intro: Cochlearia fumarioides, commonly known as the bladder campion, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy, low-growing stems and clusters of pink or purple flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are typically basal, rounded, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Cochlearia fumarioides is adapted to cold climates and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
